flawed_nl_solution:
Out of every 5 berries, she eats 1, so only 5 strawberries - 1 strawberry = <<5-1=4>>4 strawberries go into the basket for each handful.
The basket holds 60 strawberries, so it will take 60 strawberries / 4 strawberries per handful = <<60/4=51>>51 handfuls to fill the basket.
So in total, Susan will pick 60 strawberries + 51 handfuls * 1 strawberry eaten per handful = <<60+51*1=111>>111 strawberries.
#### 111

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15, not 51. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
